meanings.definition: The action of disconnecting or separating something.
meanings.sent1: The dissociations of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put them back together.
meanings.sent2: The dissociations of the magnets caused them to repel each other.
meanings.sent3: The dissociations of the socks in the laundry led to some mismatched pairs.
meanings.sent4: The dissociations of the colors in the painting created a striking contrast.
meanings.sent5: The dissociations of the branches from the tree made it look barren.

meanings.definition: A mental process of disconnecting oneself from one's thoughts, feelings, or identity.
meanings.sent1: Her dissociations from reality made it hard for her to focus on everyday tasks.
meanings.sent2: His dissociations from his emotions left him feeling numb.
meanings.sent3: The dissociations from his own memories made him feel like a stranger to himself.
meanings.sent4: Her dissociations from her past self were like shedding an old skin.
meanings.sent5: The dissociations from her true feelings kept her from expressing herself fully.
